project_descr: request for conditional use authorization pursuant to section 812.89 of the planning code to install a total of three antennas to be flush-mounted on the sides of the fourth-story balconies and to install five screened equipment cabeints to be located on the rooftop of the existing four-story structures as part of sprint's wireless telecommunications network
ayes: baltimore, chinchilla, fay, joe, lim, salinas, theoharis

project_descr: request for temporary two year conditional use authorization for a public commercial surface parking lot. the proposal is to construct a temporary expansion to an existing parking lot on the subject vacant site. the conditional use authorization would be valid for tow years only as an interim use. the site consists of (5) five former lots merged into a new lot. the existing surface parking lot occupies 56% or 16,500 square feet of the 29,715 square foot newly merged lot. the proposal would expand the temporary parking use to cover the entire site. the parking capacity will be increased by 15 cars, for a total of 110 self-park spaces, including five handicapped spaces
ayes: baltimore, chinchilla, fay, joe, lim, salinas, theoharis

project_descr: request for discretionary review of building permit application no. 2001/02/20/2471, proposing to construct a one-story vertical addition with a second floor deck facing east
action: all discretionary requests have been withdrawn

project_descr: discussion and consideration of proposed amendments to the planning commission's inclusionary housing policy
speakers: joe latorre, dr. arelious walker, marty dalton, kelly dearman, reverend arnold townsend, tania alexander, lynn sedway, gregory richardson, rev. ed stewart, bill poland, pamela duffy, calvin welch, bob myers, john bardis, tim tosta
action: no action taken. public comment remains open. item will be brought back to the commission in november.

speaker_statements.speaker: joe latorre
lines: mayor's office of housing
the items listed in his letter are not focused on the appropriate percentage of units or the income levels that should be targeted
the list is meant to start a process of thinking, not to signal a definite outcome

speaker_statements.speaker: dr. arelious walker
lines: pastor of the church of god in christ
would like to discuss affordable housing offsite
affordable housing in the bayview is not going well
has been trying to find a solution for years
has lost up to 35 families from the community who moved because they cannot afford housing

speaker_statements.speaker: marty dalton
lines: private developer, upc holdings
was thrilled when dr. walker approached him to build affordable housing
shares the vision to move some inclusionary housing offsite into neighborhoods where it is most needed
analysis comparing high-rise downtown vs. low-rise neighborhood offsite shows more units of the same quality can be produced faster
seeks commission support to formulate the mechanism and make it happen

speaker_statements.speaker: kelley dearman
lines: haight street mortgage co.
many people feel they cannot afford a home; they help people access affordable homes
held a credit repair and pre-qualification seminar in the bayview with great attendance
many are anxious to be homeowners in san francisco if the opportunity arises

speaker_statements.speaker: reverend arnold townsend
lines: presented a tangible project to show moving inclusionary housing off-site where possible
recommends adopting this as commission policy
would provide stability in communities that need it badly

speaker_statements.speaker: tania alexander
lines: caring and restoration homes / true hope church
native san franciscan who had to move away because she couldn't afford to live here
she and her husband do community work in san francisco but must cross two bridges to come into the city

speaker_statements.speaker: lynn sedway
lines: real estate and urban economist and consultant, sedway group
the commission is challenged with the goal of producing more affordable housing
increasing the inclusionary percentage seems easy but will reduce housing production, especially in downtown high-rise developments

speaker_statements.speaker: gregory richardson
lines: richardson consultant
fully supports the inclusionary process
for a city to grow the community must be stable and have a base; without a base there is no hope
all americans dream of owning a home
asks the commission to consider the proposals and decide with harmony and understanding

speaker_statements.speaker: rev. ed stewart
lines: community assembly of god
supports the inclusionary process
will help young people in his congregation find a home
will help retain energetic, viable people by encouraging them to remain in the city

speaker_statements.speaker: bill poland
lines: disagrees with parts of mr. gosh's cost presentation
submitted a housing affordability study by recurs university handed out by urban land institute in boston
the target for necessary housing is understated
people want to live here even if they work elsewhere in the bay area
demand is very high

speaker_statements.speaker: pamela duffy
lines: urges consideration of how programs interact across the full housing market, from very-low-income to market-rate consumers

speaker_statements.speaker: calvin welch
lines: council for community housing organizations
nonprofits cannot build their way out of the affordability problem; inclusionary zoning involving the for-profit sector is key
the affordability gap is extraordinary

speaker_statements.speaker: bob myers
lines: architect and city planning consultant
summarized a survey of affordability and inclusionary requirements from san jose to sacramento
typical city has no requirements or 10% at most; only three jurisdictions exceed that to 15% (the extra 5% is at 100% of median) where height, density, and parking bonuses are negotiated
cities considering higher requirements worry they will drive market-rate developers to other communities

speaker_statements.speaker: john bardis
lines: mr. gosh made an interesting case: the program would help some households, but its costs would inflate the price of market-rate units produced by the same project
considers this a flaw in the program

speaker_statements.speaker: tim tosta
lines: steffel, levitt and weiss
recognizes the complexity and difficulty of changing a policy that must meet many needs

project_descr: request by metro pcs for conditional use authorization to install a wireless telecommunications facility pursuant to planning code section 712.83 which includes the installation of nine panel antennas, one GPS antenna and equipment cabinets at the apollo theater. the subject site is a preference location 4
speakers: debra stein, steven r. currier, boris delepine, lawrence lee, blanch simons, peter del valle

speaker_statements.speaker: debra stein
lines: representing sprint pcs
this is a preference 4 site
there have been letters of support and letters of opposition
there was an alternative site, but the apollo theatre was preferred

speaker_statements.speaker: steven r. currier
lines: outer mission residents association
initially opposed; after learning the planning department’s conditions, the organization has no position
there are apartments at the apollo theatre
the building has been an eyesore for many years

speaker_statements.speaker: boris delepine
lines: office of supervisor gerardo sandoval
the board’s housing, transportation, and land use committee continued legislation for a six-month moratorium on cell antenna installations for 60 days pending review of guidelines
industry, the neighborhood antenna-free union, and residents will work together and return in 60 days with siting recommendations
requests the commission not approve now and instead continue the item for 60 days to pursue a consistent citywide plan

speaker_statements.speaker: lawrence lee
lines: owner of the subject building
the building has been vacant for over 10 years, vandalized, and occupied by homeless individuals
plans to renovate the shopping corridor on geneva street
cell phones are a necessity; it is critical to build out wireless infrastructure

speaker_statements.speaker: blanch simons
lines: lives next door to the subject property
served as the building’s manager for many years
there has been vandalism at the building
hopes the commission will approve the project

speaker_statements.speaker: peter del valle
lines: resident across the street from the subject property
if the project is approved, an appeal will be filed

amendments: property maintenance. upon approval of the conditional use authorization, the property owner shall maintain the main entrance to the b uilding and all sidewalks abutting the subject property in a clean condition. such maintenance shall include, at a minimum, daily litter pickup and disposal, and washing or steam cleaning of the main entrance and abutting sidewalks at least once each two weeks
ayes: baltimore, chinchilla, fay, joe, lim, salinas, theoharis

project_descr: request for conditional use authorization under planning code section 711.43 to allow the establishment of a bakery/cafe (boulange marinette) of approximately 2,500 square feet which is considered a large fast food restaurant pursuant to planning code section 790.90

speaker_statements.speaker: alfred sanchez
lines: this is a quality bakery
he spoke to everyone in the neighborhood as well as the various neighborhood associations and everyone supports this project

amendments: 1) there will be no wholesale sales. 2) property maintenance. upon approval of the conditional use authorization, the property owner shall maintain the main entrance to the building and all sidewalks abutting the subject property in a clean condition. such maintenance shall include, at a minimum, daily litter pickup and disposal, and washing or steam cleaning of the main entrance and abutting sidewalks at least once each two weeks
ayes: baltimore, chinchilla, fay, joe, lim, salinas, theoharis

project_descr: request for conditional use authorization for: (1) the development of a site larger than 9,999 square feet pursuant to planning code section 712.11 and 121.1; (2) the establishment of a use that would be larger than 5,999 gross square feet pursuant to planning code section 712.21 and 121.2; and (3) for the development of housing with fewer than 25-percent affordable units and for the establishment of a use that would be larger than 2,999 gross square feet pursuant to the board of supervisors resolution number 518-01 (mission district interim controls).
speakers: howard mo, t.c. chen, ada chan, eric quesada

speaker_statements.speaker: howard mo
lines: he opened a family-owned grocery store in 1987
he and his wife have worked very hard
by approving this project, there will be more housing and more local employment
this would be a better future for the neighborhood

speaker_statements.speaker: t.c. chen
lines: project architect
they are proposing a project that will improve the appearance of the area. it will maintain and not destroy the existing business. this project will also increase rental units
the details of the exterior are similar to the surrounding buildings
this project also has support from the chinese merchant's association

speaker_statements.speaker: ada chan
lines: mission anti-displacement coalition
there are various aspects of this project that they are in aggreement with
they would like to have 25 percent affordability as a benchmark
they are neutral but she wanted to highlight both sides

speaker_statements.speaker: eric quesada
lines: mission anti-displacement coalition
they know they have to work with the developers to try to get affordable housing
they are excited about this project in the neighborhood

amendments: that one additional unit will be designated as an affordable unit. the affordable unit is required to be available to households that make between 80 and 120-percent of median income per the guidelines set forth by HUD and the mayor's office of housing

project_descr: mandatory discretionary review of a change of use from a grocery store and public parking lot to a grocery store, laundry, and apartment building. board of supervisors resolution no. 518-01 requires mandatory discretionary review for any chagne of use within the mission district
preliminary_recommendation: do not take discretionary review and approve the project as proposed
speakers: howard mo, t.c. chen, ada chan, eric quesada
action: do not take discretionary review. project was approved as modified
amendments: that one additional unit will be designated as an affordable unit. the affordable unit is required to be available to households that make between 80 and 120-percent of median income per the guidelines set forth by HUD and the mayor's office of housing

project_descr: request for a rear yard modification pursuant to planning code section 134(e), which allows the zoning administrator to waive or modify the rear yard requirement in neighborhood commercial districts. planning code section 134(a)(3) requires a minimum of a 40-foot deep rear yard for the proposed project at each level where residential units would be located. the proposal would include parking within the rear yard area on the second level; the second level would include residential units on the front (mission street) side of the building. because parking is not permitted in the rear yard, the second level would not be considered to have a code-complying rear yard.
speakers: howard mo, t.c. chen, ada chan, eric quesada
action: the zoning administrator granted the variance

project_descr: mandatory discretionary review of building permit application number 2001/07/16/3762 proposing to change the limited commercial use from business service to retail sales
speakers: mousa aldababneh, john maimone, abraham aldababneh

speaker_statements.speaker: mousa aldababneh
lines: this is a wonderful spot to open a cafe
there are no coffee shops around this area
they just won an award -- the best place to meet the neighbors
he has letters of recommendations as well as one from Supervisor Daly

speaker_statements.speaker: john maimone
lines: he lives on south van ness
he is excited about this coffee shop opening up
he would like to have a commitment from the proprietor to make sure that the street will not be littered

speaker_statements.speaker: abraham aldababneh
lines: his brother is the project sponsor
his brother has been running a coffee shop for the past 5 years
his brother is well liked by the neighbors

preliminary_recommendation: do not take discretionary review and approve the project as proposed
action: take discretionary review and add the following street cleaning condition
amendments: upon approval of the conditional use authorization, the property owner shall maintain the main entrance to the building and all sidewalks abutting the subject property in a clean condition. such maintenance shall include, at a minimum, daily litter pickup and disposal, and washing or steam cleaning of the main entrance and abutting sideawlks at least once each two weeks
ayes: baltimore, chinchilla, fay, joe, lim, salinas, theoharis

project_descr: mandatory discretionary review of building permit application number 2001/08/02/5145 proposing to (1) change the use of ground level commercial space from other retail sales and services/ (planning code section 712.40) to full-service restaurant (planning code section 712.42), (2) perform interior renovations and (3) performa facade alterations. discretionary review is required by board of supervisors resolution number 518-01 (mission district interim controls for any permit proposing to change the use of a property within the mission district. the subject property is currently a vacant grocery and flower store
type_district_2: mission alcoholic beverage special use sub-district
preliminary_recommendation: do not take discretionary review and approve the project as propoesd

speaker_statements.speaker: terry chastain
lines: owner, papa toby's
he started his restaurant when the area wasn't that good
he is an artist so he supports artists and making sure that the people enjoy their stay there
he hopes that the commission approves this project

action: take discretionary review and add the following street cleaning conditions: property maintenance. upon approval of the conditional use authorization, the property owner shall maintain the main entrance to the building and all sidewalks abutting the subject property in a clean condition. such maintenance shall include, at a minimum, daily litter pickup and disposal, and washing or steam cleaning of the main entrance and abutting sidewalks at least once each two weeks
ayes: baltimore, chinchilla, fay, joe, lim, salinas, theoharis

project_descr: request for discretionary review of building permit application no. 2001/0404/5988 proposing to add a third floor to an existing two-story over basement, single-family residence
preliminary_recommendation: do not take discretionary review and approve the plans as submitted
speakers: tim falvey, henry shain, marelene forde, bill buda, scott emblidge, betsy bloomenthal, jonathan root, gary millar, bea baldeuf, arlene getz, milton f. reiterman, phil arnantou, james steyer

speaker_statements.speaker: tim falvey
lines: dr requestor

filed a discretionary review after a community meeting upon realizing the sponsor sought approval from west clay street neighbors but not other nearby neighbors most impacted by the third-floor addition
opposes the design as not meeting neighborhood design guidelines
believes the house would become significantly taller than surrounding homes

speaker_statements.speaker: henry shain
lines: has lived on lake street for about 17 years
notes additional signed letters in opposition from neighbors who could not attend
states no one on west clay park has ever built up
argues the sponsor is spending a million dollars on guest bedrooms and impacting the whole neighborhood

speaker_statements.speaker: marlene forde
lines: lives on lake street
worried about setting a precedent
describes the area as a sweet community she does not want changed

speaker_statements.speaker: bill buda
lines: he and his wife live on lake street
oppose the project because west clay park housing has remained the same for many years
wants to keep the structure and uniqueness of west clay park as it is

speaker_statements.speaker: scott emblidge
lines: representing the project sponsor
calls it a good neighborhood for families; sponsor wants to remain
notes mixed designs throughout the neighborhoods
project will be three stories over a basement; third floor under 1,000 square feet; adds about 6 feet in height by building into an existing attic
states plans were revised to address neighbors' issues

speaker_statements.speaker: betsy bloomenthal
lines: recently moved to the bay area
in addition to a guest room, they want an office, which would cause them to lose a bedroom
walked the neighborhood with their architect to ensure the design fits the neighborhood character

speaker_statements.speaker: jonathan root
lines: before submitting to the building department, presented plans to mr. falvey
states the design has been revised many times

speaker_statements.speaker: gary millar
lines: project architect
designed with sensitivity to neighborhood character and neighbors' concerns

speaker_statements.speaker: bea baldeuf
lines: has lived on west clay park for 39 years
believes the sponsor and architect have carefully planned an attractive addition
supports the project

speaker_statements.speaker: arlene getz
lines: has lived on west clay park since 1950
third oldest resident of the neighborhood
supports the project wholeheartedly

speaker_statements.speaker: milton f. reiterman
lines: resident of west clay park for 31 years
supports the project and the sponsor's family

speaker_statements.speaker: phil arnantou
lines: lives next to the proposed addition
says the sponsor has fully cooperated with neighborhood concerns
supports the project

speaker_statements.speaker: james steyer
lines: describes the area as a nice family community
notes the sponsor contacted everyone for opinions and concerns
supports the project completely

action: did not take discretionary review and approved the plans as submitted
ayes: baltimore, chinchilla, fay, joe, lim, salinas

project_descr: staff initiated discretionary review of building permit application no. 2001/07/31/4957 for installation of three flush mount panel antennas and one GPS antenna on the third level of sutro tower, and installation of related equipment cabinets encloesd in the third level of the tower.

speaker_statements.speaker: debra stein
lines: representing metro pcs
thanks the planner for doing a great job on the project
clarifies it is not certain the antennas will be removed; this is a metro pcs business decision
sutro tower is a consolidated communications tower designed to serve the entire city
sutro tower is one of the most secure infrastructure facilities in san francisco
there have been suggestions that an antenna on this tower is necessary
this is a standard cellular antenna with no structural, visual, or health impacts

speaker_statements.speaker: sean elsbernd
lines: legislative aid to supervisor tony hall
supervisor hall shares neighbors’ concerns near sutro tower
nearby neighborhoods already host many antennas; asks how much is too much and when saturation is reached

speaker_statements.speaker: shaw-lin chen
lines: homeowner; midtown terrace homeowners association
speaking on behalf of 842 homeowners
approval would bring the total to over 240 antennas across more than 5 sites
the residential neighborhood is already saturated with antennas
on october 1 the neighborhood requested a meeting; on october 10 met with the sponsor and sutro tower
learned the site is not technologically necessary for metro to deliver service
argues customers would be better served by a lower-to-the-ground system typical in the industry
other carriers serve customers without antennas on sutro tower, suggesting this is feasible for metro
residents should not bear the consequences of metro’s poor planning
notes additional safety concerns with the proposal

speaker_statements.speaker: doris s. linnenbach
lines: has attended sutro tower meetings since 1966
sutro was originally a television and fm tower; was never told it would host so many cellular antennas
requests the commission take discretionary review and allow meaningful dialogue with sutro tower

speaker_statements.speaker: tracey hughes
lines: san francisco neighborhood antenna-free union (snafu)
urges the commission to listen to opponents of the project
states all antennas must follow wts guidelines and believes this one does not; maybe it is exempt but she is unsure
different antenna frequencies could interfere with 911
community members do not have big hotshot lawyers to do research for them
it is time to stop these antennas

action: did not take discretionary review and approved the building permit with the standard conditions for facilities on sutro tower
ayes: baltimore, chinchilla, fay, joe, salinas, theoharis
